intro: Biancaea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered biancaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
